channel.title: Half-life 2 update
channel.description:
I noticed Steam started to download an update for Half-Life 2, and the details page now shows achievments. Can this be the long awaited Orange Box upgrade?
EDIT: Changelog: [quote] Updates to Half-Life 2, Half-Life 2: Episode One and Half-Life 2: Episode Two have been released. The updates will be applied automatically when your Steam client is restarted. The major changes include:
Half-Life 2 Added support for Mac Added Steam Cloud support for save games Added new achievements Improved graphical effects
Half-Life 2: Episode One Added support for Mac Added Steam Cloud support for save games Added new achievements Improved graphical effects
Half-Life 2: Episode Two Added support for Mac Added Steam Cloud support for save games
Note: Save games for Half-Life 2 and Half-Life 2: Episode One will go through a transition. The current level you are on will be saved, but not the exact position in the level. [/quote]

item.title: Half-life 2 update
item.dc:creator: Generalismo_Benzino
item.description:
freundin88:

[COLOR=‘Magenta’]Okay, here’s something I still don’t understand (even after the updates). If Gordon has two hands for the Gravity Gun, why doesn’t he have any hands for the air boat or buggy ? Is he doing something with them we can’t see? :what:

[COLOR=‘Yellow’]WHY PWUPU![/SIZE]

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life 2 update
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
Orpheon:

I can’t find a video of it but there’s another glitch…if you get the gnome positioned correctly in the back window, it won’t come out when you’re driving, which is helpful for the little rocket man achievement. However, at seemingly random areas in the map, it will cause the jalopy to stop as if you hit a rock or tree. When you get out and look at it, dust comes out of the car and it makes noises as if the car is hitting something over and over. Alyx usually makes her “oof we hit something” sounds too. It doesn’t stop until you take the gnome out.

That sounds like a simple physics glitch that can be done with a lot of things. I’ve gotten both the dune buggy and the jalopy jammed on certain things that make it impossible to move, even with grav gun assistance. The gnome’s probably acting like a fixed object such as a tree, and since it’s IN the car you can’t deal with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life 2 update
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Cameron :smiley: :

Yaybugs
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Akl6sAXWJxc
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ii6HNbVxPhs

In the second one the guys standing by the fence talking are missing too. (“Dr. Breen again? I thought I’d seen the last of him in City 13.” “I wouldn’t say that too loud…”) In fact it looks like you bumped into the area where they were supposed to be lol

Maxey:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3b-oLnPsDg

I can’t find a video of it but there’s another glitch…if you get the gnome positioned correctly in the back window, it won’t come out when you’re driving, which is helpful for the little rocket man achievement. However, at seemingly random areas in the map, it will cause the jalopy to stop as if you hit a rock or tree. When you get out and look at it, dust comes out of the car and it makes noises as if the car is hitting something over and over. Alyx usually makes her “oof we hit something” sounds too. It doesn’t stop until you take the gnome out.

Read full topic

Neither is the airboat lamp. In fact none of the areas in Water Hazard are dark enough to need a light.

item.title: Half-life 2 update
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Cameron :smiley: :

The coast has a lot of dark tunnels.

Yes, but they were empty and easy to transverse. I mean, a light on the buggy would be nice, but not really necessary or even useful. You could put it to use on a mod, but then you might as well just script it in yourself. I can’t be that hard, right?

Aha, I figured out why the coast levels were giving me HDR-less fullbright grief. HDR was disabled for some reason. :facepalm:

Read full topic
